Clue.name: Check Landing Gear Handle in down position
Trim tabs should be set to 0 or Neutral
Bus 1 should be not less than 23 volts
Bus 2 should be approximately 2 volts less than Bus 1
Bus 2 should be should be not less than 20 volts
Check the Standby Attitude Indicator flag removed
Note to self - make sure can see out window
Check Landing Gear Handle in down position
Ensure Prop set to High RPM
Ensure Mixture set to Full Rich
Turn on Battery 1 and 2 and Alternator 1 and 2
Ensure Prop set to High RPM
Ensure Mixture set to Full Rich
Set the throttle between 1000 and 1200 RPM
Both MFD and PFD displayed in normal mode

CheckpointDesc.ExpectationTT: AC DOOR EXTD - ILLUMINATED IF AC ON

Clue.name: Drop of not more than 50rpm, max drop 150rpm
6° nose up if only front seats are occupied
CHECK FREEDOM OF MOVEMENT AND PROPER DIRECTION OF TRAVEL
For 3650 lbs - Flaps UP = 73 KTS // Flaps Approach = 67 KTS
SET FUEL FLOW AT CYAN CLIMB FUEL FLOW MARKER

CheckpointDesc.ExpectationTT: MCP Climb - 2700 RPM / Cruise Climb - 2500 RPM

Clue.name: MAINTAIN FUEL FLOW AT CYAN CLIMB FUEL FLOW MARKER

CheckpointDesc.ExpectationTT: 100 KTS FOR MCP CLIMB / 110 KTS FOR CRUISE CLIMB

Clue.name: Return the mixture control to full rich before turning the aux fuel pump off.
Avoid prolonged idle settings. Cylinder head temperature should not fall below the green band

The mixture must be manually enriched as the airplane descends. An optional procedure is to retard the throttle as the airplane descends to maintain a constant manifold pressure. Then adjust the mixture to maintain the EGT within its limits.
or as required by field elevation
or as required by field elevation
Until clear of obstacles, then trim to 110 KTS
